trans-unit.source: Lists the Microsoft UI Automation control patterns, the classes that clients use to access them, and the interfaces providers use to implement them.
trans-unit.target: Lists the Microsoft UI Automation control patterns, the classes that clients use to access them, and the interfaces providers use to implement them.

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Lists the Microsoft UI Automation control patterns, the classes that clients use to access them, and the interfaces providers use to implement them.
trans-unit.target: Lists the Microsoft UI Automation control patterns, the classes that clients use to access them, and the interfaces providers use to implement them.

trans-unit.source: The table in this topic describes the Microsoft UI Automation control patterns.
trans-unit.target: The table in this topic describes the Microsoft UI Automation control patterns.

trans-unit.source: The table also lists the classes used by UI Automation clients to access the control patterns and the interfaces used by UI Automation providers to implement them.
trans-unit.target: The table also lists the classes used by UI Automation clients to access the control patterns and the interfaces used by UI Automation providers to implement them.

trans-unit.source: The **Control pattern** column shows the pattern name from the UI Automation client perspective, as a constant value listed in [**Control Pattern Availability Property Identifiers**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Ee671199).
trans-unit.target: The **Control pattern** column shows the pattern name from the UI Automation client perspective, as a constant value listed in [**Control Pattern Availability Property Identifiers**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Ee671199).

trans-unit.source: From the UI Automation provider perspective, each of these patterns is a [**PatternInterface**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242496) constant name.
trans-unit.target: From the UI Automation provider perspective, each of these patterns is a [**PatternInterface**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242496) constant name.

trans-unit.source: The **Class provider interface** column shows the name of the interface that providers implement to provide this pattern for a custom XAML control.
trans-unit.target: The **Class provider interface** column shows the name of the interface that providers implement to provide this pattern for a custom XAML control.

trans-unit.source: For more info about how to implement custom automation peers that expose control patterns and implement the interfaces, see [Custom automation peers](custom-automation-peers.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info about how to implement custom automation peers that expose control patterns and implement the interfaces, see [Custom automation peers](custom-automation-peers.md).

trans-unit.source: When you implement a control pattern, you should also consult the UI Automation provider documentation that explains some of the expectations that clients will have of a control pattern regardless of which UI framework is used to implement it.
trans-unit.target: When you implement a control pattern, you should also consult the UI Automation provider documentation that explains some of the expectations that clients will have of a control pattern regardless of which UI framework is used to implement it.

trans-unit.source: Some of the info listed in the general UI Automation provider documentation will influence how you implement your peers and correctly support that pattern.
trans-unit.target: Some of the info listed in the general UI Automation provider documentation will influence how you implement your peers and correctly support that pattern.

trans-unit.source: See [Implementing UI Automation Control Patterns](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Ee671292), and view the page that documents the pattern you intend to implement.
trans-unit.target: See [Implementing UI Automation Control Patterns](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Ee671292), and view the page that documents the pattern you intend to implement.

trans-unit.source: Used to expose the properties of an annotation in a document.
trans-unit.target: Used to expose the properties of an annotation in a document.

trans-unit.source: Used for controls that can be docked in a docking container.
trans-unit.target: Used for controls that can be docked in a docking container.

trans-unit.source: For example, toolbars or tool palettes.
trans-unit.target: For example, toolbars or tool palettes.

trans-unit.source: Used to support draggable controls, or controls with draggable items.
trans-unit.target: Used to support draggable controls, or controls with draggable items.

trans-unit.source: Used to support controls that can be the target of a drag-and-drop operation.
trans-unit.target: Used to support controls that can be the target of a drag-and-drop operation.

trans-unit.source: Used to support controls that visually expand to display more content and collapse to hide content.
trans-unit.target: Used to support controls that visually expand to display more content and collapse to hide content.

trans-unit.source: Used for controls that support grid functionality such as sizing and moving to a specified cell.
trans-unit.target: Used for controls that support grid functionality such as sizing and moving to a specified cell.

trans-unit.source: Note that Grid itself does not implement this pattern because it provides layout but is not a control.
trans-unit.target: Note that Grid itself does not implement this pattern because it provides layout but is not a control.

trans-unit.source: Used for controls that have cells within grids.
trans-unit.target: Used for controls that have cells within grids.

trans-unit.source: Used for controls that can be invoked, such as a [**Button**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209265).
trans-unit.target: Used for controls that can be invoked, such as a [**Button**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209265).

trans-unit.source: Enables applications to find an element in a container, such as a virtualized list.
trans-unit.target: Enables applications to find an element in a container, such as a virtualized list.

trans-unit.source: Used for controls that can switch between multiple representations of the same set of information, data, or children.
trans-unit.target: Used for controls that can switch between multiple representations of the same set of information, data, or children.

trans-unit.source: Used to expose a pointer to the underlying object model of a document.
trans-unit.target: Used to expose a pointer to the underlying object model of a document.

trans-unit.source: Used for controls that have a range of values that can be applied to the control.
trans-unit.target: Used for controls that have a range of values that can be applied to the control.

trans-unit.source: For example, a spinner control containing years might have a range of 1900 to the current year, while another spinner control presenting months would have a range of 1 to 12.
trans-unit.target: For example, a spinner control containing years might have a range of 1900 to the current year, while another spinner control presenting months would have a range of 1 to 12.

trans-unit.source: Used for controls that can scroll.
trans-unit.target: Used for controls that can scroll.

trans-unit.source: For example, a control that has scroll bars that are active when there is more information than can be displayed in the viewable area of the control.
trans-unit.target: For example, a control that has scroll bars that are active when there is more information than can be displayed in the viewable area of the control.

trans-unit.source: Used for controls that have individual items in a list that scrolls.
trans-unit.target: Used for controls that have individual items in a list that scrolls.

trans-unit.source: For example, a list control that has individual items in the scroll list, such as a combo box control.
trans-unit.target: For example, a list control that has individual items in the scroll list, such as a combo box control.

trans-unit.source: Used for individual items in selection container controls, such as list boxes and combo boxes.
trans-unit.target: Used for individual items in selection container controls, such as list boxes and combo boxes.

trans-unit.source: Used to expose the contents of a spreadsheet or other grid-based document.
trans-unit.target: Used to expose the contents of a spreadsheet or other grid-based document.

trans-unit.source: Used to expose the properties of a cell in a spreadsheet or other grid-based document.
trans-unit.target: Used to expose the properties of a cell in a spreadsheet or other grid-based document.

trans-unit.source: Used to describe a UI element that has a specific style, fill color, fill pattern, or shape.
trans-unit.target: Used to describe a UI element that has a specific style, fill color, fill pattern, or shape.

trans-unit.source: Enables UI Automation client apps to direct the mouse or keyboard input to a specific UI element.
trans-unit.target: Enables UI Automation client apps to direct the mouse or keyboard input to a specific UI element.

trans-unit.source: Used for controls that have a grid as well as header information.
trans-unit.target: Used for controls that have a grid as well as header information.

trans-unit.source: For example, a tabular calendar control.
trans-unit.target: For example, a tabular calendar control.

trans-unit.source: Used for items in a table.
trans-unit.target: Used for items in a table.

trans-unit.source: Used for edit controls and documents that expose textual information.
trans-unit.target: Used for edit controls and documents that expose textual information.

trans-unit.source: Used to access an element’s nearest ancestor that supports the **Text** control pattern.
trans-unit.target: Used to access an element’s nearest ancestor that supports the **Text** control pattern.

trans-unit.source: Provides access to a control that modifies text, for example a control that performs auto-correction or enables input composition through an Input Method Editor (IME).
trans-unit.target: Provides access to a control that modifies text, for example a control that performs auto-correction or enables input composition through an Input Method Editor (IME).

trans-unit.source: Provides access to a span of continuous text in a text container that implements [**ITextProvider**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242627).
trans-unit.target: Provides access to a span of continuous text in a text container that implements [**ITextProvider**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242627).

trans-unit.source: Used for controls where the state can be toggled.
trans-unit.target: Used for controls where the state can be toggled.

trans-unit.source: For example, [**CheckBox**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209316) and menu items that can be checked.
trans-unit.target: For example, [**CheckBox**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209316) and menu items that can be checked.

trans-unit.source: Used for controls that can be resized, moved, and rotated.
trans-unit.target: Used for controls that can be resized, moved, and rotated.

trans-unit.source: Typical uses for the Transform control pattern are in designers, forms, graphical editors, and drawing applications.
trans-unit.target: Typical uses for the Transform control pattern are in designers, forms, graphical editors, and drawing applications.

trans-unit.source: Allows clients to get or set a value on controls that do not support a range of values.
trans-unit.target: Allows clients to get or set a value on controls that do not support a range of values.

trans-unit.source: Exposes items inside containers that are virtualized and need to be made fully accessible as UI Automation elements.
trans-unit.target: Exposes items inside containers that are virtualized and need to be made fully accessible as UI Automation elements.

trans-unit.source: Exposes information specific to windows, a fundamental concept to the Microsoft Windows operating system.
trans-unit.target: Exposes information specific to windows, a fundamental concept to the Microsoft Windows operating system.

trans-unit.source: Examples of controls that are windows are child windows and dialogs.
trans-unit.target: Examples of controls that are windows are child windows and dialogs.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You won't necessarily find implementations of all these patterns in existing XAML controls.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You won't necessarily find implementations of all these patterns in existing XAML controls.

trans-unit.source: Some of the patterns have interfaces solely to support parity with the general UI Automation framework definition of patterns, and to support automation peer scenarios that will require a purely custom implementation to support that pattern.
trans-unit.target: Some of the patterns have interfaces solely to support parity with the general UI Automation framework definition of patterns, and to support automation peer scenarios that will require a purely custom implementation to support that pattern.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Windows Phone Store apps do not support all the UI Automation control patterns listed here.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Windows Phone Store apps do not support all the UI Automation control patterns listed here.

trans-unit.source: **Annotation**, **Dock**, **Drag**, **DropTarget**, **ObjectModel** are some of the unsupported patterns.
trans-unit.target: **Annotation**, **Dock**, **Drag**, **DropTarget**, **ObjectModel** are some of the unsupported patterns.
